item.title: Microsoft is forcing its AI assistant on people—and making them pay | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Microsoft is forcing its AI assistant on people—and making them pay

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Company Business News

Microsoft is introducing its AI assistant, Copilot, to customers who may not want it, along with an increase in subscription fees for its Microsoft 365 services in certain regions.

  • Copilot is now part of the Microsoft 365 subscription in Australia and Southeast Asia.
  • Microsoft has raised prices for users of the subscription service as part of this rollout.
  • This move is part of Microsoft's strategy to boost excitement for its AI products.
“Microsoft is trying a new approach to build excitement for its artificial-intelligence assistant Copilot: Give it to customers whether they want it or not.”

This approach may raise concerns among consumers regarding privacy and the viability of forced upgrades.

item.title: LIVE news: Economy to grow at around 6.5% in FY25, says FinMin - Business Standard
item.description:
Economy to grow at around 6.5% in FY25, says FinMin

Publication Date: November 2023 - Source: Government Economic Report

India's economy is expected to grow at around 6.5 percent in real terms in financial year 2025, according to the government's monthly economic report for November.

  • Economic growth forecast of 6.5% in FY25.
  • Report released by the Finance Ministry as part of its monthly updates.
  • This projection aligns with previous economic trends indicating steady growth.
“The growth in FY25 reflects the resilience of our economic policies,” Finance Minister stated.

This optimistic forecast indicates confidence in India's economic policies and potential to navigate global economic challenges.

item.title: Unimech Aerospace IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Issue booked 172.13x so far led by NIIs, retail investors. Check GMP, review. | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Unimech Aerospace IPO Day 3 Live Updates

Date: 26 Dec, 2024

Source: LiveMint

The Unimech Aerospace and Manufacturing Ltd. IPO has garnered significant interest, marking a subscription rate of 172.13x as it concludes on December 26, 2024. The price range for shares is set between ₹745-785, with an issue total of up to ₹500 crore.

  • The IPO was subscribed 9.09 times on the second day, with strong backing from both Non-Institutional Investors (NIIs) and Retail Individual Investors (RIIs).
  • As of Day 3, the issue reached a subscription level of 173.68 times, with various investor categories subscribing significantly: QIBs at 317.63x, NIIs at 262.45x, retail at 54.07x, and employees at 92.61x.
  • The company has made a notable name in high-precision engineering solutions, serving industries including aerospace, defense, and energy.
“At the upper end of its price range, UAML is demanding a P/E multiple of 68.7x, based on its FY24 EPS of ₹11.4...” - Choice Equity Broking

The strong market response showcases investor confidence in Unimech's growth potential and its established role in a sector with significant barriers to entry.

item.title: Maruti Suzuki e-Vitara All-Grip AWD testing in Snow: Details - The Times of India
item.description:
Maruti Suzuki e-Vitara All-Grip AWD Testing in Snow: Details

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The article discusses the testing of the Maruti Suzuki e-Vitara All-Grip AWD in snowy conditions, highlighting its performance and features aimed at enhancing driving safety and experience.

  • The e-Vitara’s All-Grip technology is designed for improved traction in winter weather.
  • Testing involved various terrains to evaluate the vehicle's capabilities.
  • The model emphasizes safety and handling, crucial for snow driving.
  • Insider perspectives from engineers on design considerations were included.
“This testing ensures our vehicles maintain high performance even in extreme conditions.”

This testing showcases Maruti Suzuki's commitment to safety and innovation in automotive technology, aiming to provide drivers with confidence in challenging weather.

item.title: Do apps charge higher cab fares on iPhones than on Android devices? - The Times of India
item.description:
Do apps charge higher cab fares on iPhones than on Android devices?

Publication Date: Not available
Source: Not available

This article explores the differences in cab fares charged by various apps on iPhones compared to Android devices, investigating the implications for users of each platform.

  • Investigation into fare pricing across different platforms.
  • Analysis of user experiences and feedback regarding cab fares.
  • Consideration of factors influencing pricing disparities.
"The price difference can be substantial depending on the app used and the device type."

In conclusion, this article sheds light on the potential cost differences for users based on their device choice, highlighting the need for consumers to be aware of these discrepancies when choosing their cab apps.

item.title: Adani Power, Adani Ports to Adani Green: Adani group stocks rise up to 5%. Do you own any? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Adani Power, Adani Ports to Adani Green: Adani group stocks rise up to 5%

Publication Date: N/A | Source: Live Mint

Adani Group stocks saw a rally on Thursday, with shares rising up to 5% amid strong buying momentum, while the Indian stock market benchmark indices traded flat.

  • Adani Green Energy stock surged 4.91% to ₹1,081.80.
  • Adani Power shares increased nearly 4% to ₹515.70.
  • Adani Energy Solutions shares rose up to 3.8%.
  • Adani Ports & SEZ stock gained 3.11%.
  • Adani Enterprises and Ambuja Cements were both up over 1%.
“Adani Group has identified defence and aerospace as key areas for acquisitions with a budget of $1 billion.”

The rally reflects strong buying interest amid flat trading conditions in global markets. Investors are advised to seek expert guidance before making investment decisions.

item.title: Tata Motors share: 37% down from all-time high; What should investors do with Tata stock in 2025? - ET Now
item.description:
Tata Motors Share Price: A 37% Decline from All-Time High - Investor Insights for 2025

Updated Dec 26, 2024 from ET NOW News

Tata Motors shares have seen a strong correction, crashing over 37% in the past five months from their all-time high level, returning to levels not seen in a year. Investors are speculating on the stock's future performance as it currently trades below major moving averages.

  • Tata Motors yielded a negative return of nearly 6% in 2024, contrasting with the Sensex's 8.6% gain.
  • The significant decline is attributed to weak performance in commercial vehicles and EV sales, alongside pressures from Jaguar Land Rover.
  • Analysts suggest a potential bounce back may occur, fueled by favorable candlestick patterns and chart support.
  • Current trading at Rs 745.70, with recommendations to buy, maintaining a stop loss at Rs 717.
“There is a good expectation of a bounce back in Tata Motors.” - ET NOW Analyst

In conclusion, while Tata Motors has faced challenges, analysts remain optimistic about a potential recovery in share price moving into 2025.

item.title: Top five Pharma stocks to bet on for 2025, according to Motilal Oswal Wealth - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Top five Pharma stocks to bet on for 2025, according to Motilal Oswal Wealth

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: CNBC TV18

Brokerage firm Motilal Oswal Wealth highlights five pharma stocks to consider for investment in the year 2025, based on expected growth in India's pharma sector.

  • India's Pharma industry is projected to grow by 9% to 11% in FY 2026 driven by price hikes and export demand.
  • The government has initiated a PLI scheme to promote local manufacturing of drugs.
  • Five recommended stocks are included in a curated basket with a 20% allocation each.
  • Key stocks highlighted include: Mankind Pharma, Max Healthcare, Lupin, IPCA Labs, and Piramal Pharma.
“Mankind Pharma continues to deliver better growth compared to the industry, driven by superior execution in chronic therapies.”

The analysis indicates a potential upside for these stocks based on their market positions and anticipated company performances.

item.title: Stock Market Live: Nifty, Sensex Flat As ICICI Bank, HDFC Bank Weigh But M&M, Airtel Rise - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Stock Market Live: Nifty, Sensex Flat As ICICI Bank, HDFC Bank Weigh But M&M, Airtel Rise

Date: 26 Dec 2024, Source: NDTV Profit Desk

The stock market opened higher but quickly gave up gains as key banking stocks weighed on performance. M&M and Airtel saw gains, helping to stabilize the market.

Key Highlights

  • IRCTC faces ticket booking outages.
  • Rupee volatility continues amid economic concerns.
  • ITC Hotels demerger plans announced.
  • Godfrey Phillips shares surge post COO appointment.
  • EaseMyTrip opens a new franchise store in Andhra Pradesh.
“The disruptions in ticket bookings by IRCTC coincided with a busy holiday season, adding to traveler frustration.”

Overall, the market remains cautious with future volatility likely as analysts predict further fluctuations in the forex market.

item.title: 3 New Toyota SUVs Waiting To Launch In India In 2025 - GaadiWaadi.com
item.description:
3 New Toyota SUVs Waiting To Launch In India In 2025

Date: November 2023 | Source: GaadiWadi

Toyota Kirloskar Motor is preparing to launch three new SUVs in India by 2025, including the Urban Cruiser Hyryder, Urban Cruiser EV, and a mild-hybrid Fortuner. These launches aim to strengthen Toyota's market presence in the country.

  • 7-Seater Toyota Urban Cruiser Hyryder: Launch expected by mid-2025, competing with models like MG Hector Plus and Tata Safari.
  • Toyota Urban Cruiser EV: Set to debut at the 2025 Brussels Motor Show with powerful battery options and expected to launch in India late 2025.
  • Toyota Fortuner MHEV: Adopts a 48-volt mild-hybrid system paired with a 2.8L diesel engine for improved efficiency and performance.
“The Urban Cruiser EV will feature lithium-iron-phosphate battery options enhancing power and efficiency.”

These new models illustrate Toyota's commitment to expanding its SUV lineup in the rapidly growing Indian automotive market, focusing on electrification and hybrid technology.

item.title: Suzlon Energy share price: Rs 100 in next 1 year? Check resistance and support levels - ET Now
item.description:
Suzlon Energy share price: Potential to reach Rs 100 in the next year

Updated: Dec 26, 2024 - Source: ET NOW

Suzlon Energy shares are currently trading significantly below their 52-week high, amidst a consolidation phase. Experts indicate that the stock shows strong chart structure and could potentially reach Rs 100 in one year.

  • Suzlon Energy shares are trading about 25% lower than their 52-week high.
  • The stock is currently influenced by its 200-day EMA, with an RSI around 44.
  • Market expert predicts resistance at Rs 69-70 with potential to reach Rs 100 within a year.
  • In 2024, Suzlon has returned 66.3%, 555% over the past two years, and 3360% over a longer timeframe.
“If the stock crosses the level of Rs 69-70, it can reach Rs 86. In such a situation, a buy on dips strategy should be adopted.” - Market expert Tejas on ET NOW

The outlook for Suzlon Energy shares suggests significant growth potential, especially if key resistance levels are surpassed.

item.title: Budget 2025: Money for country roads may take economy to a better place - The Economic Times
item.description:
Budget 2025: Money for country roads may take economy to a better place

Publication Date: December 26, 2024
Source: Economic Times

As preparations for Budget 2025 gain momentum, the Indian government is set to focus on rural infrastructure, particularly roads, to stimulate economic growth and social inclusion.

  • The government is expected to increase funding for rural road development by nearly 10% in the upcoming budget.
  • The Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana (PMGSY) will see an increase in its outlay, reflecting its importance in rural connectivity.
  • From 2000 to present, PMGSY has constructed approximately 769,284 km of roads, improving rural connectivity significantly.
  • The fourth phase of PMGSY aims to connect 25,000 habitations through 62,500 km of new roads.
  • Better rural roads are crucial for agriculture, enhancing market access and reducing post-harvest losses.
  • Improved roads are expected to boost rural consumption, job creation, and financial inclusion.
“Rural roads are more than just physical infrastructure; they are enablers of social and economic mobility.”

With a comprehensive approach to rural infrastructure in Budget 2025, India aims to unlock economic potential and reduce disparities, making rural development a cornerstone of its growth strategy.

item.title: Upcoming IPOs: Lotus Developers to GSP Crop Science, 5 companies file draft papers with SEBI to raise ₹3,000 crore - Upstox
item.description:
Upcoming IPOs: Lotus Developers to GSP Crop Science, 5 companies file draft papers with SEBI to raise ₹3,000 crore

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: Upstox

In 2025, five companies have filed draft red herring prospectuses (DRHP) with SEBI to raise approximately ₹3,000 crore, riding on the success of previous IPOs.

  1. Lotus Developers: A Mumbai-based real estate developer aiming to raise ₹792 crore for ongoing projects.
  2. IndiQube Spaces: A co-working space provider from Bengaluru seeking to raise ₹850 crore.
  3. Mangal Electrical Industries: A Rajasthan transformer manufacturer filed for ₹450 crore.
  4. Greaves Electric Mobility: A manufacturer of electric two-wheelers aiming for a ₹1,000 crore IPO.
  5. GSP Crop Science: An agrochemical firm from Ahmedabad looking to raise up to ₹280 crore.

Overall, India’s IPO market is gaining momentum with expectations of 89 companies going public next year.

“The strong momentum in India's booming IPO market is expected to continue in 2025.”

Investors will be watching key companies like LG Electronics India and Flipkart preparing for their IPOs.

item.title: Real estate in Hyderabad sees spike in housing prices in 2024 - The Siasat Daily
item.description:
Real Estate in Hyderabad Sees Significant Spike in Housing Prices for 2024

Date: 2024

Source: ANAROCK Research

The real estate market in Hyderabad has experienced a notable increase in housing prices, with a reported rise of 27% in 2024, attributed to increased demand and input costs.

  • Housing prices in Hyderabad reached Rs 7,300 per square foot in Q4 2024, up from Rs 5,750 in Q4 2023.
  • Overall, housing prices across seven major cities increased between 13-30% annually.
  • NCR recorded the highest price increase of 30% over the same period.
  • Despite the rise in prices, the total sales units in Hyderabad fell from 61,715 in 2023 to 58,540 in 2024.
  • The total sales value for housing jumped by 16%, reaching around Rs 5.68 lakh crore in 2024.
  • New launches in Hyderabad's real estate market dropped by 24% in 2024.
“Compared to 2023, 2024 saw a 21 percent rise in the average price in the top seven cities.” - Anuj Puri, Chairman, ANAROCK Group.

The significant surge in housing prices in Hyderabad reflects an ongoing demand for quality housing, emphasizing the city's growth in the real estate sector.

item.title: 2025 Honda Unicorn launched in India at Rs. 1.19 lakh - BikeWale
item.description:
2025 Honda Unicorn Launched in India at Rs. 1.19 Lakh

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Honda has launched the 2025 Unicorn in India, which is now compliant with OBD2B regulations and features several updates.

  • Complies with upcoming OBD2B regulations
  • Price increased by Rs. 8,180
  • Introduced new LED headlamp and a fully-digital instrument cluster

The motorcycle is priced at Rs. 1,19,481 (ex-showroom) and comes in three color options: Pearl Igneous Black, Matte Axis Gray Metallic, and Radiant Red Metallic. The previous Pearl Siren Blue color has been discontinued.

It is powered by an upgraded 162.71cc, single-cylinder engine producing 13bhp and 14.58Nm of torque, paired with a five-speed gearbox.

Furthermore, the motorcycle features a fully-digital instrument cluster with various indicators and a USB Type-C charging port.

item.title: From ₹17.25 to ₹516: Multibagger stock turns ₹1 lakh into ₹30 lakh in four years | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
From ₹17.25 to ₹516: Multibagger stock turns ₹1 lakh into ₹30 lakh in four years

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Mint

RDB Infrastructure and Power has proven to be a highly successful investment, showcasing remarkable growth over four years.

  • The stock price soared from ₹17.25 to ₹516, yielding a return of nearly 30 times the initial investment.
  • An investment of ₹1 lakh made four years ago is now valued at ₹30 lakh.
  • On recent trading, the stock experienced a significant jump, hitting an opening price of ₹529.95.
  • The company conducted a stock split of 1:10 to improve liquidity and attract more investors.
  • RDB Realty & Infrastructure has officially changed its name to RDB Infrastructure and Power.
  • The National Company Law Tribunal has approved the demerger of the company’s Realty Division.
"An investment of just ₹1 lakh in the stock four years ago would have skyrocketed to a massive ₹30 lakh today."

The significant rise in RDB Infrastructure's stock price demonstrates the potential for investor gains in the market, highlighting the importance of strategic investment decisions.

item.title: India’s Most Powerful Person Coming To Auto Expo? - MotorOctane
item.description:
India's Most Powerful Person Coming to Auto Expo?

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: MotorOctane

The Bharat Mobility Expo is set to take place from January 17 to January 22, 2025, showcasing major automobile brands and technology innovations.

  • The event will feature several high-profile attendees, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
  • Many popular automobile brands like Honda Cars India, Renault, and Volkswagen will not participate.
  • Ministers Nitin Gadkari and H.D. Kumaraswamy are confirmed to attend.
  • Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone are expected to represent Hyundai at the expo.
  • Over 5 lakh visitors are anticipated at this significant auto show, which will be the world's second-largest.
“The expo is expected to showcase India’s prowess in the field of automobile technology.”

This event is poised to highlight India's automotive advancements and gather significant attention globally.

item.title: Union Budget 2025-26 Expectations: Railway sector to get BOOST? How to trade IRCTC, RVNL, IRFC? - ET Now
item.description:
Union Budget 2025-26 Expectations: Railway sector to get BOOST? How to trade IRCTC, RVNL, IRFC?

Updated Dec 26, 2024, Source: ET NOW

The article discusses the expectations for the railway sector in the upcoming Union Budget 2025-26. It highlights the importance of Indian Railways in the economy and the significant capital allocations over the years.

  • Indian Railways is vital for transportation, encompassing a network of over 126,000 kilometers.
  • In FY2023-24, a capital outlay of Rs 2.62 lakh crore was allocated to the sector.
  • Analyst Mayuresh Joshi predicts major developments, including new stations and infrastructure projects.
  • IRCTC's shares recently dropped over 1% amid reports of an e-ticketing outage.
  • Passengers faced issues with online ticket bookings, with a significant number of outage reports noted.
  • IRCTC's stock fell by 12.43% this year against a 14.31% rise in the BSE500 index.
“Those who hold quality stocks in the railway sector should continue to hold them.” – Mayuresh Joshi

This budget is expected to have a profound impact on the railway sector, enhancing its capability and infrastructure amidst challenges.

item.title: Unimech Aerospace IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Issue booked 31.69x so far led by NIIs, retail investors. Check GMP, review. | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Unimech Aerospace IPO Day 3 Live Updates

Date: 26 Dec 2024 | Source: LiveMint

The Unimech Aerospace IPO has seen significant interest, achieving a subscription of 31.69x so far.

  • Initial public offering size: Up to ₹250 crore fresh issue and up to ₹250 crore OFS.
  • Price band set between ₹745-785 per share.
  • Subscription rates: 12.07x for non-institutional investors, 10.30x for retail investors.
  • Significant anchor investor interest, raising ₹149.5 crore prior to public subscription.
"At the upper price band of ₹785, the company is valued at FY25 annualized P/E multiple of 51.6x on post issue capital which is at a discount to its peers." - SBI Securities

Overall, the Unimech Aerospace IPO has demonstrated strong demand and positions the company well within the engineering solutions market.

item.title: 5 Upcoming 650-750 cc Royal Enfield Motorcycles In India - GaadiWaadi.com
item.description:
5 Upcoming 650-750 cc Royal Enfield Motorcycles In India

Date: November 2023

Source: Gaadi Waadi

Royal Enfield is set to launch new models in the 650-750 cc segment over the next few years, following their plan of introducing at least one model per quarter.

  • Classic 650: Based on the Shotgun 650, featuring a 650cc parallel-twin engine.
  • Bullet 650: A budget-friendly model with similar hardware to the Classic 650, aimed at affordability.
  • 2025 Interceptor 650: An updated version with cosmetic changes and new features, retaining the existing engine.
  • Himalayan 650: Expected to be the biggest launch for 2025, with an adventurous design and a 648cc engine.
  • Continental GT 750: A sportier version possibly featuring a new 750cc engine and improved braking system.
"Royal Enfield is focusing on expanding its lineup in the popular mid-size motorcycle category to attract more customers."

This strategic move is anticipated to bolster Royal Enfield's presence in the competitive motorcycle market.

item.title: IRCTC Website Down During Peak Tatkal Hours, Netizens Share Frustration On X - ABP Live
item.description:
IRCTC Website Down During Peak Tatkal Hours, Netizens Share Frustration On X

Publication Date: 26 Dec 2024
Source: ABP Live

IRCTC, the online ticket booking platform of Indian Railways, experienced a significant outage during peak tatkal hours, affecting users nationwide.

  • The website faced issues reportedly around 10:25 AM IST, impacting approximately 2,500 users.
  • Major cities affected included New Delhi, Mumbai, Ahmedabad, and several others across India.
  • Users reported seeing a 'Downtime Message' on the IRCTC website, indicating service unavailability due to maintenance.
  • IRCTC has urged customers to contact customer care for assistance during the outage.
  • Social media users expressed their frustrations, highlighting the difficulties in booking tickets.
“The IRCTC website is down, causing a lot of trouble to book tickets and also my payment got stuck.” - User on Twitter

The outage has led to significant frustration among users trying to book tickets during a busy travel period.

item.title: Stock Market Live: Nifty, Sensex Trade Flat As ICICI Bank, TCS Weigh But M&M, Maruti Gain - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Stock Market Live: Nifty, Sensex Turn Positive Led By Gains In Auto Stocks; Maruti Suzuki Top Nifty Gainer

Date: 26 Dec 2024 | Source: NDTV Profit Desk

The stock market opened positively with Nifty and Sensex gaining momentum led by the automobile sector, specifically Maruti Suzuki emerging as the top gainer in the Nifty index.

  • Broader indices underperformed benchmarks.
  • Metropolitan Stock Exchange gaining attention with a fresh equity issuance.
  • Nifty Bank erased early gains as ICICI Bank and HDFC Bank weighted down.
  • Intellect Design Arena share price hits its highest since September.
  • Analysts recommended stocks like IndiGo, Lupin, and Jubilant FoodWorks as promising buys.
“Some stocks could see upside of as much as 7–8% in the near term from current levels.”

The market continues to experience fluctuations, with positive sentiment in key sectors influencing overall performance.
